isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER AUTOMATE-2 - REASSEMBLY - LOWER SHIFT TOWER

svcproc.title: LOWER SHIFT TOWER

step1.para: Replace all worn or damaged parts and O-rings. The pistons and joiner pin are placed into the housing first ( Figure 157).
Use Lubriplate on all lower shift tower O-rings. Use some of the lubricant to hold the joiner pin in place. Install the pistons from each side of the housing ( Figure 158).

caution.para: Do not push pistons through the same side of the housing since they may bind.

step1.para: Lubricate the new housing plug O-rings with Lubriplate or the equivalent. Install the plugs into the housing ( Figure 159). Tighten to 80 ft-lbs. (108 N· m).
Lubricate the idler finger bore with Lubriplate grease. Place the idler finger over the shift finger, with the two fingers close together ( Figure 160).

figure.caption: Figure 160. Idler Finger Over Shift Finger

step1.para: Secure the fingers with a snap ring ( Figure 161). The rolled die side of the ring should be toward the idler finger.
Install a new O-ring over the shift shaft ( Figure 162).

note.para: Hold the O-ring away from the keyway to avoid damaging the O-ring during installation.

step1.para: Lubricate the shift shaft with Lubriplate grease or the equivalent. Align the shift fingers with the housing bore and insert the shift shaft ( Figure 163). It should slide easily through the assembly; do not force it. The shaft keyway must align with the shift finger key.
Install the automatic switch ( Figure 164).

svcproc.para: Attach the control arm subassembly to the end of the shift shaft ( Figure 165). Secure with the washer and bolt. Tighten to 10 ft-lbs. (14 N· m).

step1.para: Replace the gasket and then install the cover ( Figure 166). Tighten the four bolts to 32 ft-lbs. (43 N· m).
Lightly coat the rack bore with Lubriplate or a comparable high quality lubricant that won't attack the seals or metal parts. Place the shift rack into the housing ( Figure 167).

note.para: The lever slot must face up and the cut out portion must be seen through the housing for proper operation.

step1.para: Place two new O-rings on each inner piston and one new O-ring on each outer piston ( Figure 168). Lubricate them with Lubriplate or the equivalent.

figure.caption: Figure 168. O-Rings On Each Inner Piston

step1.para: Slide the pistons into the housing ( Figure 169).
Install the end caps and gaskets ( Figure 170). Tighten the bolts to 20 ft-lbs. (27 N· m).

Place new O-rings on the override plunger and cap, lubricating them with Lubriplate or the equivalent. Then install the plunger and cap ( Figure 171). Tighten the cap to 45 ft-lbs. (61 N· m). Secure it with the hitch pin.

figure.caption: Figure 171. O-Rings On Override Plunger & Cap

step1.para: Install two new O-rings in each valve port ( Figure 172). Lubricate them with Lubriplate or the equivalent.

figure.caption: Figure 172. New O-Rings In Each Valve Port

step1.para: Install the valves in their proper location-"HI," "N" and "LOW" ( Figure 173).
Install the tube assembly ( Figure 174). Hold the valves steady with a wrench while you tighten the fitting nuts.
Lubricate the shift shaft with Moly grease. Coat the actuator assembly (right, Figure 175) with purple Loctite 515 or the equivalent. Place the actuator assembly over the lever.

note.para: Make sure the control arm is aligned with the sensor in neutral position for proper operation.

step1.para: Secure it with four long bolts. Tighten the bolts to 34 ft-lbs. (46 N· m).

Install the shield. Secure with bolts. Tighten to 20 ft-lbs. (27 N· m). Attach the wire harness ( Figure 176). Next, place a gasket on the main case and install the lower shift tower assembly. Secure with bolts tightened to 31 to 45 ft-lbs. (42 to 61 N· m). Attach the upper shift tower once the unit is re-installed into the vehicle.
